reviewText:
Before buying this game, I read the reviews like any normal person would. I found alot of people saying they hated the game. I did find quite a few positive reviews though and so I decided to go for it anyways. ( I think I only paid a few bucks for it during some sale )

+ What I like:

-Climbing/Stamina System
I love the climbing aspects of this game. I have to sit and carefully plan out my ascent or descent based on how much stamina I have at my disposal. Instead of blindly climbing like in Assasain's Creed, I have to think before I climb. This is the most realistic climbing I have ever seen in a game (in terms of stamina), and I love it so much.

-Fighting
The fact that you can intimidate the enemy without any bullets and shove them down a hole is an A+ in my book! Seriously though, this game seems to have a similar theme, Think before you act". I have found myself analyzing the enemy and finding who to kill first and how to do it. The intimidation that you can produce with an unloaded gun is spectacular and I find myself using it often.

-Scenery
This game really sells the post-apocalyptic setting and between the dastardly ambushes and the unsettling music I find myslef on the edge of my seat.

+ What I dislike

Honestly there really is not that much I truely dislike about this game. The limited retry is a bit troubling
date: but it forces me to take my time and analyze every situation. The fighting system is a little tough to get at first but once you get the hang of it
recommended:
its not too bad.

+ My Thoughts

I do indeed recommend this game. I would probably not have bought it if it had not been on sale
hoursPlayed: and I don't recommend paying $15 for it. If this game does end up going on sale then I recommend getting it
voteText: as you will most likely enjoy it as I have.\nThe trick to this game is to have patience and not rush into things. If you try to play this game like an FPS game
helpfulPercent: you will not enjoy it. This game is all about conserving the small pile of resources you have while trying to stay alive. It's a refreashing change from the FPS games I usually play.\n\nThanks for reading my review

reviewText:
A great yet horrific game. Some of the experiences in I Am Alive may cause you to question if you would rather be alive or dead in such a scenario. It's a gritty brutal experience not dissimilar to Metro 2033 & sequel set to Ranger Mode & no HUD. Albeit different in location and story direction.

My only real issues with the game is its poorly designed camera configuration settings. Which may be overlooked by some as a difficulty increasing factor. I would say set to its highest difficulty the game in terms of nerve jarring, fear generation moments of frustration to survive is on par with DemonSouls and Darksouls (The First).

The question is will you emerge from this wasteland or will it claim you for one of its own while you slip into the insanity that unfolds...?

8/10.
Well worth its current price at 15$.
I paid 20 on the Playstation and felt the experience was worth it.
I'm primarily a PC gamer and bought it again to support.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: There is enough freedom in this to be considered a game but still remains as restrictive as an interactive story. The devs have created a beautiful little portion of the city with only one path to progress the story. Sure, there are enough forks in the road to cause you to think you have some freedom of choice but it ultimately leads to the same destination. So long as you keep in mind that you are playing through an interactive story, this game will be satisfying from start to finish.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Forget what IGN says about this game. Another great game from UBISOFT; there are some known actors and gameplay from SCC but that's fine. This game is psychological tension. Lots of moral actions to take but hard to do, because you have to find the items required for each individual that you perform moral actions with. There are some creepy elements in the game but they are not that bad, though the psychology can be really scary. Gameplay is realistic, really realistic, so take your time to play them. Short game but it's fun. Just don't play in the dark or at night. :) You'll have fun learning the deep scars of human or the great passions of people, fighting and finding your lost family members. Kinda like Heavy Rain, haha. A great game. 8/10, scary but great fun to play!

reviewText: If you like thinking your way through things, this is an apocalyptic survival game you probably want to pick up. I am Alive will deliver thrills down your back as it constantly greets you with unique scenarios/puzzles that put you on the verge of death. reviewText:
I would reccomed this game to others, but only if you get it on sale like I did. It was very suspensful and SUPER creepy. The layout and mapping system reminded me of Silent Hill Downpour, but the movement was a little like Assasians Creed. You are able to climb up skyscrapers, sparta kick people into firepits, use a crossbow, and much much more. Although, it was a little confusing on where you should go sometimes it was still pretty awesome. It was a shorter game, but there are some achievements that you can get.

The storyline was a little off. I wish that it showed more of him trying to get to his family instead of helping anothers. It left off on a cliffhanger, and I'm not too fond of it. Also, the checkpoints were your saving points. There is no place for you to save your game, becuase it automatically does so. That was probably the most annoying part of the game. (Besides the ridiculous solar contrasted rays of light in your eyes)

As for the items, there was always a supply of them. I never had any issues, except when climbing with the pitons. My only advice would be to use certain items sparingly (piton, bullets, medkits etc.) The other items (canned food/fruit, water, soda, painkillers, etc.) were always available if you looked around and scavenged. I ended the game with a lot more than what I needed.

Altogether, I thought that this was a very good game. It was really fun to play, and I would give it an 8/10

reviewText: This game is amazing, but its not for everyone.. The atmosphere of this game is awsume, it really sucks you in, and you might even start too feel yourself feeling kinda down, and dreary and hopeless like the game portrays so well. The graphics are well done, nothing spectacular mind you, but pull the feel of the world perfectly. I love how even just exploring your surroundings is deadly. The toxic dust will kill you within a few minutes, before you need to climb something tall so you can get above and get some air. Really forces you too think and find the quickest ways around. I love how the combat is done, resources are super limited, finding even a single bullet is like hitting the jackpot! So you really have to stratagize too find ways to take out bad guys using as little as possible. Using bluffs to try to outsmart your opponents, its almost emotinal combat, see if you can bluff your opponent and read his emotional state too see if you can make him surrender, or will you need to use a precious bullet to take him out? Once you take down a group of 5 men using only a single bullet, you will feel like a total badass! Totally recommended if you enjoy exploration, lots of climbing, and a slower paced game. The combat is really different, and alot of fun, but if your wanting an fast paced action game, you won't find it here..

reviewText: I have been wanting this game for a long time after I first saw it on Youtube, this game was totally under the radar and it looked so good I just wanted it right then, but at that time there where only a Ps3 verion out, when it finally showed up to PC here on Steam I just grabbed it, so is it worth it? the game is certanly nothing spectacular and the graphics was a bit disapointing even if they are ok I guess, it gives that post apocalyptical atmosphere really good and it have a great story, you have to climb obstacles to move on in the game, sometimes it will be a great challenge because you just can't figure out how to do it. so you have to think your self trough it mostly. it is a climbing game simular to Tombraider, there are bandits on the way you have to take care of. there are no monsters or goblins in this game and was a fresh wind, the game tries it best to realistic simulate the end of the world, the controls are a bit broken and is the bad part of the game, other than that, it is a good game and is entertaining to play, I would recommend pick this game up on sale, if it wasn't for the awkward controls I would have given 7/10 but I will only give a 5 out of 10 for that reason, still it is a recommended buy if you can get it cheap. but I would only recommend it if you like the post apocalyptic genre, if not, there are better games you can blow your money on.

reviewText:
Reviews said this game was what Survival fans have been waiting for, what the Post-Apocalyptic genre has been lacking. Well, I'm not really a Survival fan, especially when it comes to Survival Horror, but after all the latest Zombies games like Rage and Dead Island - I Am Alive is original, innovative and artistic.

Instead of killing Zombies with a somehow everlasting arsenal of weapons, from blades and clubs to grenade launchers and Molotov cocktails, this time the scenario is far more realistic. An event has occurred, a global catastrophe. The protagonist, after travelling for a full year, returns to his home to try and find his wife and daughter. His enemy? The dust in the air depleting his stamina and health, the physical obstacles (holes, collapsed structures, improvised barriers and barricades, and worst of all - most of the other survivors, stereotypically selfish, evil and deadly).

If you rush into combat in this game, you'll die. There's no attack" option
date: only certain actions requiring careful planning
recommended: strategy and patience. A lot of the game is spent trying to figure out how to reach your next destination
hoursPlayed: by climbing ruins and jumping gaps. My favourite bit about the game is the attention to role-play details. Being able to threaten unarmed opponents to surrender
voteText: helping victims in need by sharing supplies for information
helpfulPercent: and how certain survivors just want to be left alone but won't attack - all create a fantastic mood and suspense of disbelief all the more easy for us deep role-play fans.\n\nThe graphics are smart
votesHelpful: by that I mean that the use of dust in the air made it possible to have low quality details as far as the enviornment goes
votesTotal: but high realistic details when it comes to characters and the near surroundings. The music is also great! The actual game-play is not my cup of tea
votesFunny: but I've very glad to have played this game. The story
column16: the characters
column17: the world - all make for an extremely fun gaming experience. Survival fans? This is most definitely a must game for you lot. Not survival fans? You would still enjoy this
column18: but I would wait a year or two so as to pay a cheaper price."

그 공백사이에 생존을 위하여 살육과 약탈이 진행되는 그 도시 속에

세계관의 분위기와 인간의 이기심과 존엄성 여부에 대한 질문을 던짐으로서

한 남자의 생존기를 담은 캠코더,

reviewText: People give I Am Alive a lot of crap for being short and linear (then they go back to playing CoD, oh the stupidity). I Am Alive is not as short as people make it out to be, but it isn't as long as a normal game (Think about if you took both Burial at Sea episodes and combined them, that's how long this game normally is). The gameplay mechanics are basic enough with a few gimicks (such as the bluff mechanic) and the AI is pretty solid. I also haven't run into any bugs like people are complaining about. All in all, don't listen to the majority of the people who say crap about this.\n\n7.5/10

reviewText: This a good short game with some unique gameplay elements. The combat system is very realistic, every decision impacts how longer you can survive so you need to make the best of all combat encounters. Resources are scarce in the beginning of the game, but you will be able to find plenty later if you save as much as you can. For the most part, your worst enemy will be your stamina, when climbing buldings you have to watch it carefully so you do not deplete it, thus reducing your stamina capacity. For some parts, you will need some resource items to restore your stamina when climbing up, else you will not be able to proceed. The story is very simple and can be ignored for the most part. The controls are not so responsive, but they usually work alright.

reviewText:
Though interesting and very immersive, this post-apocalyptic survival does not allow for a lot of freedom. Areas are restrictive and not every solution a player has for a problem is supported; Knowing you can jump and climb doesn't mean a crate next to a fence will allow you to climb over that fence...and stuff like that. Extending that, it is a very linear game...

The combat system and problems one is faced with are interesting though, and a player will have to bluff with an empty gun more than once. The developers also did a great job with the environment and allow the player to help people in need, if the player should choose to do so, depending on available resources.

It is the kind of game I wouldn't play much, but do enjoy once in a while.

reviewText:
I don't like reading reviews or watching trailers before I watch a movie, and have a similar approach to games. Sometimes, a game is a waste of time and sometimes you hit the jackpot and finally play a game that feels different and is worth playing. I AM ALIVE is a true rare gem.
I am so grateful that somebody out there is not making more call of duty sequels or clones. I like an FPS as much as the next guy, but come on already. Give us something new, a new challenge. This is why I liked I AM ALIVE so much. The resource management aspect of it alone added a whole new layer of challenges to the game. The stamina, the food, the thirst. This game really drew me in and made me feel like I was in danger.

I give this game 9.5 out of 10, if I say why not 10/10 then I'll spoil the plot, but there you go.

I play most of my games with an xbox 360 controller, and Big Picture mode will sort the games by controller support. I got a warning saying this game required a mouse and keyboard, not true, it works beautifully with an xbox controller.

If you're a gamer, and got other things to do besides play run and gun on multiplayer, then add this game to your wish list today.

reviewText: Although I'm not far into it, I'm prepared to say that this game is probably the best survival game I've ever played. The climbing/combat mechanics are totally unique, even if things don't work as planned all the time. I really enjoy the climbing sections, as they require a bit of strategy and energy management, so the solutions are not always obvious (but they're usually fair). The combat is great, too. Being required to intimidate and prioritize enemies adds some much needed nuance in the shooter genre. The story, from what I can tell, is well told which just adds to the whole experience. It's like Mirror's Edge, but slower and more deliberate. Check it out!

reviewText: Overall a decent game, though not worth full price in my opinion. Rather short game for $15, but it was fun. For me the only downsides are the controls, which as I've read work really well with a controller, and that is made very apparent early on with movement and the menu interface when using a keyboard/mouse. The other big downside is the saving feature, its soley based on autosaves, with checkpoints and chapters as you go along. My main gripe with it is that several times when I was playing, after taking a break I would lose progress within a chapter even though I was clearly at a checkpoint, further testing aside, it seems that checkpoints are only active during the current play session. I also kind of dislike how machete use isn't active, its only used from scripted encounters [undetected kill, close quick time" attack]\n\nTL:DR: worth it on sale

It has an innovative combat system, to were if you aim a gun at someone who has no ranged weapon they will put their hands up, and this means that if there is a fire or cliff nearby, you can kick them into it. However, this gets clunky, and while ammo is scarce if you only pick it up yourself, shoot an enemy that has a gun and  you get your ammo back. A true flaw that feels lazy and unfinished is the story. Your nameless, however not silent protaganist will trust the sketchiest of characters, and the ending doesn't tie up loose ends. reviewText: For all of it's flaws, it does pull you in and make you feel like you're really a normal person trying to survive in a inhospitable landscape surrounded (I use the term losely) by people who are trying to do the same. The washed out landscape with obstructed view makes you feel alone and the limited supplies really make you helpless. I also think it was the first time I felt really guilty about killing someone. The first guy you kill in the game wasn't necessarily an evil guy, just a guy who was scared and at the end of his rope. Everything just happens so fast (for me at least) and at the end, I thought, did I just kill a guy? Maybe its cause there is no tangible reward, but I didn't feel good about it. Even when I had to take out the guys who are after the little girl (who really deserved it) didn't make me feel like I did something great, just that I did what had to be done. I really started to care about what happened to that little girl and worried that if I was gone for too long, something would happen to her. The way the game makes you feel like that without openly shaming you or giving you some kind of morality meter made it feel real. It you want that kind of feeling, and aren't easily frustrated (because the game does not hold your hand at all and managing resources/failing to plan ahead is punishing), give it a try.

reviewText:
Overall, the game was good.

I Am Alive features unique survival gameplay that is able to stand alone among similar games in the genre. Resources are scarce, combat is challenging, and the world seems to have a heavy, oppressive feel to it.

The game features a clever climbing system where the player must utilize stamina effectively, and a unique combat system that attepts to humanize the enemies.
Although the gameplay is fantastic it's storyline is not. It is short, only four or five hours long, and left me dissatisfied and empty (this meaning that there was no clear resolution to the story). But, despite that fact, I would still give the game a  7/10 or 8/10.

It is worth a playthrough. But wait to get it while its on sale.

reviewText:
This is one of those games I enjoyed playing but I equally enjoy having completed it.

The post-apocalyptic environment is well built and you really get into the mood of the game. It's a depressing and gritty game and the designers have been spot on with creating the setting.
You spend a lot of time running around and climbing. The climbing mechanics works quite well; you climb in a manner similar to that of AC, but with the added feature that you have limited stamina that decreases while climbing. This means that you only have a limited time climbing before you have to find a secure spot to recover stamina if you don't want to risk dying mid-climb. It's a feature that I actually ended up loving as it added a (slightly) realistic pressure on an otherwise very generic climbing functionality.
The game is probably the closest you'll get to Last of Us on PC.

The graphics on the technical side is mediocre at best. It's clearly a console port and had a bit of extra work been put into the title the graphics could have been so much better.
The camera angles - my god. You are not able to zoom out when moving around and you're stuck to the neck all the time and I didn't feel any potential overview being lost. With that said; when climbing large buildings the camera zooms out (some times) to give you a better over of the surrounding routes.
The mouse controls are... wonky. Weird sensitivity and it feels sluggish.
The groups of enemies you meet are often same combinations as previous encounters, meaning that encounters, though challenging due to very limited resources, become routine.
Very linear.

Despite the concept of the game was/is great and I loved it, the technical issues and repetitions made it at the same time feel a bit... off. Had you asked me during a gaming session whether I would recommend it or not I'd probably say no. Looking back at it now I'd say yes. In the end it all depends on how accepting you are of the technical limitations of the game.

reviewText:
A game that deserved the full release it was orignially intended to be, I am Alive is the PC equivalent of the Last of Us. The game starts out by throwing the player right into the thick of it. You will have to learn as you go that things are bad, really, really bad and only your own wits will help figure out how to survive. Supplies are very limited and making a choice of shooting some thugs versus avoiding them alltogether or giving up precious supplies to aid a civilian in need is always hard. In certain situations these sacrifices that you make will help out, but you never know if you will get anything in return. That is the beauty to the gameplay here, you make your own way to the destinations marked on your map as you discover where you need to go next and the choices you make result in either your survival or death, it is brutal and black and white.
You quickly learn to not trust your fellow man and getting creative with your combat is just part of the fun.

The story will hit home right off the bat and the ending will make you think, but the fetch quests to get to the end make the otherwise realistic feeling of the atmosphere fade and give way to the fact that you are playing a game. However, this everyman appraoch to the character is ultimately what you as the player make it to be and you have the choice to do or not do certain parts of this story quest. Thus making up for the prior shortcoming because you are given a canvas and a paintbrush.

The graphics leave a lot to be desired and you might be best served by applying mods the reduce the film grain and remove the BW filter from the game, but those are in place for atmospheric reasons and nail the point this game tries to et across. Leaving them on for the first playthrough is recommended.

As a package there is good replay value and you get a fun experience for your money. The lack of co-op or the ability to join or form factions in the single-player campaign is disheartening as this would have bolstered the experience but as a downloadable title this holds up really well without.

reviewText:
First of all, I didn't know of this game until I saw it on YouTube (for me, it's the best way to see the game as it is, without having to trust someone's opinion) and found it interesting enough to try. People say it could've been better (and it's not uncommon for Ubisoft to promise more and deliver less), but I only saw the final product and I base my opinion on that.

What's good
- Post-apocalyptic setting with modern day people reduced to savage state.
- The concept of making an extreme effort and losing stamina capacity after depleting the bar.
- More or less open world with lots of secrets (even a place to catch a breath over the dust-filled streets is a welcome discovery) that often require risky approach to find and reach.
- Bandits with varying attitude: some don't take you seriously and even try to attack if you hold them at gunpoint for too long without shooting, some are not too brave and submit at gunpoint or after someone else has been shot.
- Music that fits the visual style (and that creepy loop inside the boat is a full Silent Hill experience).

What's bad
- Clunky controls, with action prompt not always coming up (I had one guy standing IN the fire and still wasn't able to push him; Leonidas in me was disappointed) or the character trying to mimic the camera direction with his movements, refusing to move at all sometimes.
- Weird gamepad buttons assignment and no way to remap them.
- Camera is wayward and target switching is way too sensitive (it even allows turning backwards from the enemy, which makes no sense and only brings harm).
- Weapon slots not assigned to number keys, only to mouse wheel, which makes weapon selection hard to control mid-combat.
- The ending that feels more unfinished than simply open".

What's broken
- Keyboard shuts down or gets stuck on one key every now and then
date: have to plug it out and back in 3-4 times per hour on average. The problem doesn't depend on keyboard manufacturer and is known since\n2012
recommended: but has not been patched to this day. Given the Ubisoft officials' initial refusal to port the game at all (and the game is worth porting

reviewText: I thought I would enjoy this game despite the critics... I was wrong. It's not awful, but it's clunky and uninspired. You will soon enough realize you are far from the only one who is alive (I certainly didn't feel like a ''lone survivor'' for long... maybe 5 minutes of gameplay?), and the reason for the death of the majority of the population is never explained in any satisfying way. Though the game itself is only moderately challenging, the clunky controls and camera and awful combat make it fairly annoying to play. There is survival aspects at play here, and some work fairly well, but some game mechanics feel unnecessary or cliché. Last but not least, I Am Alive is very linear, which is very much a missed opportunity in this type of game. When you do try to explore, you are often reminded that ''you're going the wrong way'' or something along those lines.\n\nAs I said above it's not an awful game, but there are so many much, much better games to play that I wouldn't recommend I Am Alive except if you are a complete fan of the genre and you've played every other game already, and it is on sale.

reviewText:
This game is like series of QTE separated with cutscenes and walking sections.

Unfortunately i gave up after 1h. Probably i m still in tutorial section [but how do i know? Went to the lookout in the mall and was on my way back] because i cannot do anything i would expect from survival game, i have to follow beaten path and obey given orders. Go straight ahead and press buttons that are displayed on the screen.

Game makes good first impresion raising the expectations bar but then takes it all away and instead of survival game you are rewarded with interactive movie.

On top of that it is obvious console port with attached emulator to support pad controls. Unfortunately i couldnt run game with my pad because of that embedded emulator within the game. It is a minor flaw as i am used to play with knm but still...

Game could be great but instead was disappointing. I hope somebody would grab this idea and create more interactive production.

reviewText:
I enjoyed the tense atmosphere throughout the entire game. The dialoges are honest and there is not too much nor to little talk going on between the charakters. There is lots of stuff to explore in a price-of-persia/Assassins-creed-like fashion that requires some thinking and planing ahead in order to acomplish. The small riddles are well hiden as well and deliver a pleasent feeling of satisfaction after you complet them.

Without revealing too much of the story to you, all I want to point out is that after finishing the game for the first time, I felt like there is still too much to do to let it end there. :)
The worst drawback of the game is the bad camera handling. Quite frequently the camera wouldn't turn according to the mouse's movement like hitten a wall with it. I really wonder why that failure still exists at this time though...

If you get the chance to get this game at a cheaper price, I honestly recommend you to give it a try it's a hidden Double chocolate cookie" ^^"
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
So I recommend this game with extreme caveats. If you want to see a really good IDEA for a game, this is a decent pick-up. I think this is a good look for game developers looking to see how scavenging mechanics can be implemented fairly well. Ammo is scarce, climbing is dangerous and your supply of safety equipment is extremely limited, and still this game gives you a way to complete challenges. The atmosphere is very well done and the world is quite immersive (if you can excuse some of the control issues).

THAT BEING SAID:  (SPOILERS)

This game is unfinished and will never be finished. There is no real story arc other than some amorphous bull about finding someone missing that will never come to fruition for the player.  Controls, as mentioned are frustrating to learn, and even once mastered, can easily be screwed up by happenstance (like, trying to jump somewhere but instead leaping to your death).

If you don't go into this game expecting a full, round, complete experience, you'll be better off for it, BUT this game will give you an interesting experience that I haven't really gotten from many other games.

reviewText:
First of all, I didn't know of this game until I saw it on YouTube (for me, it's the best way to see the game as it is, without having to trust someone's opinion) and found it interesting enough to try. People say it could've been better (and it's not uncommon for Ubisoft to promise more and deliver less), but I only saw the final product and I base my opinion on that.

What's good
- Post-apocalyptic setting with modern day people reduced to savage state.
- The concept of making an extreme effort and losing stamina capacity after depleting the bar.
- More or less open world with lots of secrets (even a place to catch a breath over the dust-filled streets is a welcome discovery) that often require risky approach to find and reach.
- Bandits with varying attitude: some don't take you seriously and even try to attack if you hold them at gunpoint for too long without shooting, some are not too brave and submit at gunpoint or after someone else has been shot.
- Music that fits the visual style (and that creepy loop inside the boat is a full Silent Hill experience).

What's bad
- Clunky controls, with action prompt not always coming up (I had one guy standing IN the fire and still wasn't able to push him; Leonidas in me was disappointed) or the character trying to mimic the camera direction with his movements, refusing to move at all sometimes.
- Weird gamepad buttons assignment and no way to remap them.
- Camera is wayward and target switching is way too sensitive (it even allows turning backwards from the enemy, which makes no sense and only brings harm).
- Weapon slots not assigned to number keys, only to mouse wheel, which makes weapon selection hard to control mid-combat.
- The ending that feels more unfinished than simply open".

What's broken
- Keyboard shuts down or gets stuck on one key every now and then
date: have to plug it out and back in 3-4 times per hour on average. The problem doesn't depend on keyboard manufacturer and is known since\n2012
recommended: but has not been patched to this day. Given the Ubisoft officials' initial refusal to port the game at all (and the game is worth porting
hoursPlayed: despite its flaws) on the ground of all PC gamers being pirates
voteText: such obvious bug in PC version is appaling to say the least. Well
helpfulPercent: modern day Ubisoft can't even make a Tetris game right…\n\nSo
votesHelpful: I give it 7.5/10. The game is overall enjoyable if you are into exploration
votesTotal: but it's a bit unfinished and seriously lacks quality in porting."

reviewText: A really underappreciate game. It has his flaws but the atmosphere and the universe is overwhelming. The survival aspect his pretty great, adding tense climbing gameplay, walking in thick dust that drains your stamina, having to trick ennemies to save the very few bullet you have (or because you don't have any bullet) and trying not to miss your only arrow. The story is very compelling and the music adds a unique feel to it. A great idea for a survival video game and I still recommend it because it was a great experience.\n\nDownload the graphic patch (you can easily find it on internet) to fix the colour problem.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Another game port from console to PC from Ubisoft, another failure they refuse to fix.

For the amount of time this game has been out, its rather disappointing to see such a good looking game go down the drain. Input lag, unstable areas that even an R9 390 cant handle and broken parts that make the game just unplayable isn't a good sign. I never played this on console, however after plugging in a controller, I still found the game to stutter and most of the time not even register many button presses. This caused me to fail some missions, not due to difficulty, but due to my button presses not being registered by the game. After revealing the controller to not be the fix, I moved back to mouse and keyboard. Certain areas will almost appear as though the game has switched your DPI down automatically as dragging the mouse around stops working momentarily. This issue I found most annoying.

My opinion would be to buy this game only if you're a Ubisoft fan, and don't intend on playing it or can overlook these issues, but to everyone else, the game is too broken to enjoy. I was lucky enough to pick up this game at 80% off, but still feel ripped off. If you do buy/have bought it, I'd recommend requesting a refund or else it'll end up being another addition to your steam library that will get uninstalled and never installed again.

reviewText: The PC game that almost wasn't.  Many reviewers give this game a bad rap.  Many of the systems need polished, but the core of this game if outstanding.  I compare this game to The Walking Dead; Less choose your own adventure, but more room to get out and play.\n\nWhen other games give it all away, or make it an impossible win, I am Alive forces you to plan ahead, manage your resources and keep your goal in your sights.  This game deserves better, and I would love to see a sequel.

reviewText: Das positive zuerst : Es hat eine tolle Endzeit grafic in der alles Schwarz-weiß ist. Es ist ein Endzeit-survival game also ist es reallistisch und man hat wenig munition und wenig leben. Das negative : Die Steuerung ist etwas hackelig und gewöhnungsbedürfdig aber sonst ist sie in ordnung. Ab und zu kommen dir einfach zu viele gegner angerannt ( so ende Spiel), dann kann es schon mal frustrierend werden wenn etwas nicht funktioniert. Die Charakteren sind etwas leblos und das Ende des Spieles ist auch nicht ganz zufriedenstellend. Fazit : Das Game hat höchen und tiefen wobei tiefen warscheinlich mehr vorhanden sind. Dennoch kann I Am Alive auch seine schönen und guten Momente im Spiel haben. Ich gebe dem Spiel         5.5/10 Punkten.

reviewText:
I'm sure there's many who would really enjoy this but I got refund because I didn't enjoy it

Pros
- I enjoyed the encounters with survivors
- Atmospheric
- Decent story
- The optional retry system help gives a survivor vibe

Cons
- Repetitive
- The environment is annoying, my path got blocked by a f*cking shopping trolley.... and there were so many times when it would have been easy to simply climb over something or move it but you can't
- Lack of interactive environment
- Controls felt a tiny bit awkward at times

I recommend seeing some gameplay it's not too bad just wasn't what I wanted
